name: Ginger Simple Syrup
preparation:
You can’t scoot too high up the cocktail tree without coming across a recipe that calls for ginger simple syrup. The bar staple is a must for anyone looking to make a proper Penicillin or Moscow Mule. Another great use for ginger simple syrup? Homemade ginger ale. Simply add it to ice, soda water and a squeeze of lime.

Bring all ingredients to a boil in a small saucepan, stirring until sugar is dissolved.

Remove from heat and let sit covered for 20 to 30 minutes.

Double-strain into a jar. Keep sealed in the refrigerator for up to 2 weeks.
